subject: Politics
title: The Legislature
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Legislature.

hook.text: Parliaments, congresses, and assemblies â€” every democracy has a legislature. It's where laws are born.

buildup.text: The legislature debates, amends, and votes on laws. It also controls government spending.

discovery.text: Most legislatures have two chambers. The US has the Senate and House. Britain has Lords and Commons.

twist.text: Legislators often spend more time fundraising than actually writing or debating laws.

climax.text: A weak legislature means a strong executive. When parliament is sidelined, democracy shrinks.

punchline.text: Legislatures make laws. When they fail, executives fill the vacuum.

quiz.question: What are the two chambers of the US legislature?
options: The Senate and the House of Representatives
